summary: This is a confidential transcript of the continued videotaped deposition of Ghislaine Maxwell, taken in a civil case against her in the Southern District of New York. The deposition focuses on questioning by plaintiff's counsel David Boies about Maxwell's sexual activities with Jeffrey Epstein and others at his properties, specifically in Palm Beach, New York, and the Virgin Islands.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant being deposed in a civil case. She is questioned extensively about her sexual relationship with Jeffrey Epstein and her knowledge of his activities with others.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Central figure in the questioning. Maxwell testifies about her sexual relationship with him and her awareness of his sexual activities with others at his properties.

persons.name: Jeffrey S. Pagliuca

connections.description: Maxwell admits to a sexual relationship with Epstein and participating in three-way sexual activities with him and other women at his Palm Beach home.
Boies is the examining attorney for the plaintiff deposing Maxwell, representing the opposing party in the litigation.
Pagliuca is Maxwell's defense attorney, objecting to questions and instructing her not to answer during the deposition.
Opposing counsel in the deposition, frequently debating the scope of questioning and objections.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Deposition
events.description: Continued videotaped deposition of Ghislaine Maxwell in a civil case against her, focusing on her sexual activities with Jeffrey Epstein and others.

events.title: Sexual Activities at Epstein's Palm Beach Home
events.description: Maxwell testifies she engaged in sexual activities with Jeffrey Epstein and, on a few occasions, with other women (a blond and a brunette) in three-way encounters at Epstein's Palm Beach home.

locations: 575 Lexington Avenue, New York, New York (law offices of Boies, Schiller & Flexner, LLP where deposition was held)
Mr. Epstein's home in Palm Beach
Mr. Epstein's home in New York
Mr. Epstein's property in the Virgin Islands
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell admits under oath to having a sexual relationship with Jeffrey Epstein.

Maxwell testifies she engaged in three-way sexual activities with Epstein and other women (specifically a blond and a brunette) at his Palm Beach home in the late 1990s/early 2000s, stating these were with 'a few' (five or fewer) women whose names she does not recall.
Maxwell claims she was not aware of Epstein having sexual activities with anyone other than herself and the women involved in those few three-way encounters.
Maxwell denies ever giving massages to anyone, including Epstein or the plaintiff (whose name is redacted in the transcript).

The deposition involves frequent objections from Maxwell's attorney, Jeffrey Pagliuca, regarding the form and foundation of questions, and instructions not to answer certain questions, leading to debates about the scope of a court order.
